result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Lee Williams

records.addlTxt:
Branch 11 is in trial. Branch 11 is in trial. Court moves bail bond hearing to 10/04/2022 at 3:00pm. State is not available at the given time. Matter is rescheduled, parties notified. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 3, 2022; received and filed.
Defense Sentencing Memorandum; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Character Reference Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Treatment Verification Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Employment Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Henry Lee Williams in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Henry Lee Williams in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and will receive blood results and an offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Henry Lee Williams in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Defendant Henry Lee Williams in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 2 prior OWI's and Monroe County case 20CT112. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Jacob Huber - MPD Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court by video, defendant Henry Lee Williams not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice Of Motion To Adjourn - received

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 4.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Henry Lee Williams in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Henry Lee Williams in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Henry Lee Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
